result.execSummary:
The defendant Len T Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by 2/5/2021 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail to apply if applicable.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Concurrent with count two.  Credit for six days. Time served disposition.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any  other sentence.  Concurrent with count one. Credit of six days. Time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Len T Perry

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant
Received and Filed, Defendant's letter requesting for exemption.   bb

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to TWO (2) COUNTS amended as follows:

COUNT 1:  Theft-Movable Property, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.
COUNT 2:  Criminal Damage to Property, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.01(1), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

Court sentenced defendant to serve SIX (6) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence BUT CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER with credit for SIX (6) DAYS days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 02-05-2021 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Len T Perry in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant left the documentation at his residence.  Defendant will need to communicate the next date to his Attorney.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that the Defendant has paid the Restitution in total.  Defense requested any Warrant issued be STAYED.  State did NOT object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 2, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter before the Court to address Restitution.  Defendant has remaining SIXTY DOLLARS ($60.00) to meet the 'good faith effort'.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has tendered a further ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($100.00) towards Restitution.  Defendant has now paid a total of SIX HUNDRED FORTY DOLLARS ($640.00) towards Restitution as of this date.  HALF of the Restitution has been agreed upon as a 'good faith effort'.  ONE THOUSAND ONE HUNDRED NINETY-NINE DOLLARS ($1,199.00) is the HALFWAY point.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to the matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense advised that Defendant is in need of encouragement.  Milwaukee JobWorks is willing to work with the Defendant.  Court went off the Record to allow Counsel time to confer.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant is paying towards Restitution.  Defendant tendered a further ONE HUNDRED FIFTY DOLLARS ($150.00) towards Restitution.  State advised that Defendant has paid a total of FIVE HUNDRED FORTY-FIVE DOLLARS ($545.00) towards Restitution as of this date.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for August 22, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has tendered a further ONE HUNDRED TWENTY DOLLARS ($120.00) towards Restitution.  Defense advised that Defendant SHOULD be able to make the agreed upon TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($200.00) per MONTH.  Defendant to pay ONE THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($1,200.00) towards Restitution before the State will deem the effort 'good faith'.  Defense outlined the reason(s) why Defendant was UNABLE to pay the full TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($200.00) per month.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has gained FULL-TIME employment.  State WITHDREW their motion to REVOKE.  Defendant has ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY DOLLARS ($140.00) towards Restitution this date.  State will need to confirm the Victim's address.  State advised that if Defendant can provide ONE - HALF (1/2) of the total Restitution AND if Victim does NOT object,  they may deem the halfway point as a completion.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant is close to paying off Restitution.  State advised that Defendant has paid only FIVE point SIX PERCENT (5.6%) of the total amount of Restitution over the length of this DPA.  This DPA was entered into on 10-16-2014.  Court went off the Record to hold Sidebar in Chambers.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that he is working with Milwaukee Jobs.  Court went off the Record to contact Milwaukee Jobs.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

**COURT VACATED THE STAYED WARRANT FROM THE PREVIOUS DATE**

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has tendered a further EIGHTY DOLLARS ($80.00) towards Restitution.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Dawn M Rablin for Calvin R Malone in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Attorney Calvin Malone expected the Defendant to appear.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
(2).  Restitution and Community Service.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has gained employment.  Defendant has tendered a FORTY DOLLAR ($40.00) Restitution payment at this hearing.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant of the consequences of failing the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant tendered a copy of Job search record.  Defense requested matter be adjourned to allow Defendant time to locate employment in order to pay Restitution.  Defense advised that Defendant is enrolled in a Construction program run by the SDC.  It is a ONE HUNDRED (100) HOUR program.  Defendant to begin program on 07-19-2016.  Defense advised that Defendant should be able to be placed after completion of the program.  State advised that Restitution has been the issue for months.  State advised that Defendant owes TWENTY-FOUR HUNDRED DOLLARS ($2,400.00) and has paid FIFTEEN DOLLARS ($15.00) towards Restitution at this time.  State noted that the Job search log provided by the Defendant on this date is highly inadequate.  State moved to REVOKE.  Defense objected and advised that Defendant has made a good faith effort towards obtaining employment.  Court took the Motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT at this time.  Court admonished Defendant for his non-compliance.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.

Filed;
Job search document.  Review hearing scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Review hearing proceeded on the Record. State advises the court that issue in this case is lack of restitution payment. Defense advised the court that the money the defendant had raised from previous employment was stolen. The defendant has made payment to the restitution of a total of $15.00. Defense advised the court that the defendant was laid-off early into last job. State is willing to allow more time to make payments to restitution. Court held colloquy with defendant. Case calendared for Review Hearing on 7/12/2016 at 10:00 a.m. in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has not made any payments towards Restitution since the last hearing.  Defense advised that Defendant has obtained employment as of 03-11-2016 that begins TODAY (03-14-2016).  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised the Court that Defendant has completed all terms of the DPA except for Restitution.  State advised that Restitution has been a continued issue regarding this matter.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that he is to report at 4:00pm to WCL for an employment opportunity.  Defendant to provide documentation regarding his employment opportunities.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised the Court that Defendant is recently unemployed.  State does not have their entire file.  State moves for an adjournment.  Defense does NOT object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State reports that Defendant has not paid restitution yet.  State may move to revoke the agreement if Defendant remains non-compliant.  Defendant has recently gained employment and reports he will begin paying restitution.  Court will adjourn matter to Br. 33 for Review.  Review Hearing calendared for 12-15-2015 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Calvin Malone appears on behalf of the Defendant Len T Perry who appears in person.  Brad Vorpahl appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter rescheduled due to the DA's office not having Defendant's file.  Review hearing calendared for 10-20-2015 at 01:30pm.

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has recently tested positive for THC.  Defendant has begun community service and attending a GED program.  Defendant needs to pay restitution.    With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is engaged in treatment, has begun community service and continues to test negative.     Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is engaged in treatment, has tested negative and has begun community service.  Review hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Len T Perry in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Jeremy Arn for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement on today.  Hearing proceed.  ADA Megan Carmody makes appearance by telephone.  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court STAYED entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report, received and filed.
